alert.note: Alert for Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Craig, Rogers, western Mayes, southern Nowata, western Wagoner, northwestern Muskogee and east central Tulsa Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 311 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles north of Nowata to 2 miles west of Foyil to 5 miles west of Inola to near Haskell. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Nowata... Coweta... Catoosa... Verdigris... Haskell... Chelsea... Inola... Oologah... Porter... Delaware... Foyil... Talala... New Alluwe... Watova... Stonebluff... Taiwah... Tiawah... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 236 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
